posts.post_content: This shade has flying while most other shades don't. Sure, its mana cost is high, but with a land-drop the following turn you can swing for 5 and flying makes it harder to block.

Posted By: TheSuperbloop (7/10/2010 1:02:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is really... interesting. At first blush, it looks like junk. Second blush too. But it's a common 2/2 flier in a color that typically gets 1 toughness fliers at common. It's also a SHADE that starts a bit large, which is also significant. Aside from that, I hate paying more than one black for the +1/+1.   
  
I would have loved to have been a fly on the wall during *this* design meeting. There are other flying shades, and this new card required them to commission/pay an artist to create it! Someone felt pretty strongly about this card!
posts.html:
This is really... interesting. At first blush, it looks like junk. Second blush too. But it's a common 2/2 flier in a color that typically gets 1 toughness fliers at common. It's also a SHADE that starts a bit large, which is also significant. Aside from that, I hate paying more than one black for the +1/+1.

I would have loved to have been a fly on the wall during this design meeting. There are other flying shades, and this new card required them to commission/pay an artist to create it! Someone felt pretty strongly about this card!

posts.post_content:
Strictly WORSE than [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp)...it doesn't combo with [Boggart Fodder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boggart Fodder).  
  
Actually, pretty bad, except for with [Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds)...but then again, that combos with EVERYTHING!!!!!!! However, this was my first ever foil, so I feel I would be too nice when I rate this card, so I won't  
  
But please, when you do, take into account that comborific ability of [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp)
